alert.note: Alert for King (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 12 at 6:37AM PST until January 13 at 1:46AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Seattle WA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Washington... Snoqualmie River Near Snoqualmie Falls affecting King County. .Heavy rain in the central Cascades will stop this afternoon. The heavy rain will push the Snoqualmie River Near Snoqualmie Falls above flood stage this morning. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Snoqualmie River Near Snoqualmie Falls. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 20000.0 cfs, the Snoqualmie River will cause widespread flooding of pasture lands and roads along the river from the town of Snoqualmie downstream through Fall City. Roads that may become flooded include Fall City-Carnation...Tolt Hill... and Novelty Flats Roads. This river level on the Snoqualmie corresponds roughly to a phase 3 flood in the King County flood system. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:15 AM PST Wednesday the flow was 19500.0 cfs. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this morning cresting around 25000.0 cfs this afternoon. The river will recede below flood stage this evening. - Flood flow is 20000.0 cfs. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 20800.0 cfs on 12/13/1966. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this afternoon at 245 PM PST.
